name: 4.7 "2 Good To Be 4 Real" Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 4 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Diane have an extra ticket to?
questions.correct: Jaques Brel is Alive and Well and Living in Paris
options: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat
A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
questions.explanation:
Jaques Brel is Alive and Well and Living in Paris.

	Jaques Brel was a Belgian singer-songwriter. "Jaques Brel is Alive and Well and Living in Paris" is a musical revue of his works.

Mime class.

	Diane was always learning. She was a self-proclaimed student of life, but also had over 80 majors. She was described on one episode as being a pseudo-intellect.

questions.text: What was Carla expecting in the mail?
questions.correct: a letter from her personal ad she placed in the paper
options: a pair of tickets to a theatre show
a letter from her ex, Nick
questions.explanation:
a letter from her personal ad she placed in the paper.

	In her personal ad she mentioned that she was divorced with six children. The others told her she needed to lie a little in her ad because six kids was intimidating.

questions.text: How old was Carla in this episode?
questions.explanation:
33.

	This episode came out in 1985. Rhea Perlman who played Carla was born in 1948, so while Carla was 33 at the time, Rhea Perlman was actually 37.

questions.text: What was the profession of the man the guys at Cheers made up for Carla?
questions.explanation:
international airline pilot.

	The guys thought they were doing something nice by making up a guy to answer Carla's ad. The problem was a real man answered Carla's ad and Carla was not interested because she wanted the fantasy guy.

questions.text: What was the name of this made up man the gang at Cheers made for Carla?
questions.explanation:
Mitch Wainright.

	Norm got a picture that came with his wallet to send as a picture of Mitch. Someone pointed out that he was a wallet picture and Carla got excited thinking that was not only a pilot but also a model.

questions.text: Who was the friend of Diane's that came to the bar?
questions.explanation:
Soto, the mime.

	Soto the mime was played by Don Lewis. Lewis has done other mime work including playing a mime in the movie "Robin Hood: Men in Tights".

questions.text: Who was the real man that answered Carla's ad?
questions.explanation:
Vinnie Claussen.

	Vince Claussen was played by Michael Alaimo. He is probably best known for his role as Greg Minor in the movie "The China Syndrome".

questions.text: What was the profession of the real man who answered Carla's ad?
questions.explanation:
funeral director.

	Carla made a joke about this in the episode when she told him, "I'd offer her (Diane) as a condolence prize but you're probably sick of stiffs."  When she found out that the other man was just made up, she gave Vinnie a chance.

questions.text: When Sam told Carla what the guys did (making up a guy), how did Carla respond?
questions.explanation:
She kicked him.

	Diane defended the guys saying that what they did was stupid, but it was done because they cared. They wanted to make Carla happy and simply didn't think out what would happen when Carla found out it was a hoax.
